## The problem

The [Subrules section of Regex](https://docs.perl6.org/language/regexes#Subrules) incorrectly says ...

> A named regex can be declared with `my regex named-regex { body here }` ...
> If no capture is desired, a leading dot will suppress it: `<.named-regex>`.

In the case of a lexical token, capture suppression is done with `<&named-regex>` ... see also discussion from rakudo issue - https://github.com/rakudo/rakudo/issues/1894#issuecomment-393977196

## Suggestions
I guess predefined tokens like `<ws>` and `<alpha>` are methods and capture suppression is done with `<.alpha>` unlike a lexical token.  Capture of grammar regexes declared without `my`/`our` are also methods and their capture suppression is done with `<.grammar-regex>`.
